name: Cairo
hint: Capital of Egypt, largest city in Africa and the Arab world

name: Lagos
hint: Largest city in Nigeria and one of the fastest-growing in the world

name: Nairobi
hint: Capital of Kenya, only capital city with a national park

name: Cape Town
hint: Legislative capital of South Africa, beneath Table Mountain

name: Johannesburg
hint: Largest city in South Africa, built on the gold mining industry

name: Addis Ababa
hint: Capital of Ethiopia and seat of the African Union

name: Casablanca
hint: Largest city in Morocco, major Atlantic port

name: Dar es Salaam
hint: Largest city in Tanzania, former capital on the Indian Ocean coast

name: Kinshasa
hint: Capital of the Democratic Republic of Congo, faces Brazzaville across the river

name: Accra
hint: Capital of Ghana, located on the Gulf of Guinea coast

name: Algiers
hint: Capital of Algeria, the White City on the Mediterranean

name: Khartoum
hint: Capital of Sudan, where the Blue and White Nile converge

name: Luanda
hint: Capital of Angola, a major port city on the Atlantic coast

name: Kampala
hint: Capital of Uganda, built on seven hills near Lake Victoria

name: Abidjan
hint: Economic capital of Ivory Coast, largest city in the country

name: Maputo
hint: Capital of Mozambique, a port city on the Indian Ocean

name: Tunis
hint: Capital of Tunisia, located near the ruins of ancient Carthage

name: Lusaka
hint: Capital of Zambia, located on a plateau in the southern part of the country

name: Bamako
hint: Capital of Mali, situated on the banks of the Niger River

name: Mogadishu
hint: Capital of Somalia, an ancient port city on the Indian Ocean coast
